segments.text: I see the woman standing there, absorbed in her dish drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sight of the overflowing sink makes my stomach drop.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so calm when there’s a small flood at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to rush in and tell her to look down, just once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are in the corner of my vision, plotting their cookie strategy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something mischievous and exciting in their eyes; it’s hard to resist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the risk of that stool tipping over looms large in my mind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the boy’s foot shift slightly—how has he not fallen yet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little hand disappears into the cookie jar, and the girl eagerly waits.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the neat garden outside is striking and unsettling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pooling, creeping closer to the cabinet edges.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every drop seems to whisper a warning, urging her to wake up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a scene caught between innocence and impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think that this moment is both sweet and scary.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will she realize what’s happening before it’s too late?
segments.speaker: PAR
